p: It may not be self-evident to most clinicians that an infectious disease that does not primarily target the brain and nervous system may have psychiatric sequelae. Early research on emerging pathogens may exclude study of the acute and long-term psychiatric effects of the illness. Proactively instituting cross-institutional research-oriented data-sharing about the psychiatric dimensions of new pathogens is imperative for providing high quality care to acutely ill patients, survivors, and caregivers.
